author: PJH118
title: Cool design, warm vibe. - Review
text:
The room, like the lobby area, balance an industrial aesthetic with warm finishes and touches. Comfortable seating areas, wood and a fireplace in the lobby play against steel and concrete. A little bar at the far end serves up both drinks and a delicious reasonably- priced breakfast menu. The staff were pleasant and helpful without being bland and corporate.
The room and bathroom could have used a few more places to open suitcases, lay out clothes, shaving kits. Lighting throughout was a touch harsh and haphazard. The view of the skyline from the upper floors on the city side is jaw-dropping. That seems a fair trade for opening a suitcase on the floor.
Long Island City is booming with a number of good bars and restaurants. Casa Enrique, 20 minutes by foot and the 7 train, lives up to its hype. Manhattan is two subway stops away, with six different lines ( pay attention! ) within ten minutes of the Boro. There are plenty of places in Manhattan that are less convenient to Manhattan. We'd return without hesitation.
Room Tip: The side with Manhattan views is very desirable. The higher the better. See more room tips
